Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TCard

java.lang.Object
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
TBillboardCard
public class TCard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A TCard instance plays the role of a single "cartella" in the traditional Italian game of Tombola. Each card is composed by 15 numbers, randomly chosen in the range [1..90] and placed on a grid of 3 rows by 9 columns, scattered so that on each row there are 4 empty spaces and 5 numbers each one belonging to a different tens.

TCard has a couple of public accessible constructors that prepare "independent", "offhand" card instances having numbers randomly chosen independently for each single card. These constructors are intended for casual use and are not the preferred way to generate a consistent amount of card objects. TMakeSix class has methods to prepare groups of 6 cards all together, usually called a "series" of 6 cards. A series is made up using all possible 90 numbers, so that there are no equal numbers among cards. Using card series optimizes performance when playing Tombola, hopefully reducing the probability of contemporary wins.

TombolaLib includes also classes implementing the ISetFactory interface and providing several heuristic algorithms aiming to generate large sets of card series while trying to reduce or limit equal numbers between cards and/or card rows.

Once prepared, cards can be saved and read to and from files. TFileFormatter objects write and read cards to and from text or binary files, in several available formats, to provide means to save works and to exchange information with other software (i.e. for card fine printing on paper, database import/export, etc.)

Finally, cards objects could be used to realize real time, digital twins of Tombola games, specially with large groups or communities of families and friends, providing support to manage cards sale and distribution, automatic cards check against extracted numbers, prizes assignment and enabling more engagement and fun with unusual, live statistics, panic generating insights, etc. TombolaLib has classes and methods to support the implementation of also these kind of applications. See TGame documentation for a first glance of what can be possible.

Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter (harry.g.potter@gmail.com)
See Also:
TMakeSix, ISetFactory, TFileFormatter, TGame, Serialized Form

    Fields

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    TCard​(java.lang.String label)
    "Offhand" constructor that can be used to randomly generate a single, well formed, independent TCard object. Each card has a label property used to uniquely identify it, specially helpful when the card belongs to a (large) set of series (see the ISetFactory interface).
    TCard​(java.lang.String label, long randomSeed, boolean avoidEmptyColumn)
    "Offhand" constructor that can be used to randomly generate a single, well formed, independent TCard object, choosing its name (label), the seed used to initialize the random numbers generator and another aesthetic parameter. Important! Passing the same randomSeed value to this constructor generates identical card objects (same 15 numbers on the cards in the same disposition).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String asString()
    Return a compact but still human readable String representing the card instance.
    int checkConformity()
    Check if the card object is correct and 'well formed', that is if its numbers are actually disposed so that the card is a valid card for the Tombola Game (five different numbers of different tens on each of the three rows, ...). This method is useful mainly when cards objects are not generated by TombolaLib constructors or generation methods, but read from external, potentially uncontrolled files or other sources.
    int checkExtraction​(int extractedNumber)
    This is the fundamental method to let check if a card gain an award during a Tombola game.
    int compareByCard​(TCard other)
    This method compare two cards (this one and the other one) looking for equal numbers between them. The amount of equal numbers found is both returned and internally saved within the state of this or the other card whenever it is higher of eventually previous saved values. Consider this method as an helping method mainly used by card sets generator algorithms to check/reduce/eliminate cards "too equal" each other, thus with higher probability to lead to concurrent wins.
    int compareByRow​(TCard other)
    This method compare two cards (this one and the other one) row by row looking for equal numbers. 9 rows couples are compared and the maximum amount of equal numbers between one of this couples is both returned and saved within the state of this or the other card whenever it is higher of eventually previous saved values. Consider this method as an helping method used within card sets generator algorithms to check/reduce/eliminate cards resulting "too equal" each other, thus with higher probability to lead to concurrent wins.
    java.lang.String evaluateCheckSum​(long offset)
    Evaluate a checksum of the Card using a simple formulas applied on the its numbers.
    int getBestRowScore()
    This method returns the value of matched numbers on the current best row of the card, that is the row where the highest value of matched numbers is reached.
    int getCurrentMaxEPC()
    Return the maximum amount of equal numbers between two cards found for this card using the compareByCard(harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard) method since the card creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
    int getCurrentMaxEPR()
    Return the maximum amount of equal numbers between each row of two cards found for this card rows using the compareByRow(harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard) method since the card creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
    int getExtractionCheckCount()
    Return the number of correct (i.e.
    int getJolly()
    Return the number (one of the 15 numbers of the card) considered "Jolly" for this card.
    int getJollyIndex()
    Return the linear index of the Jolly Number of the card, that is its position within the [0,14] array of numbers arranged on three rows and forming the card.
    java.lang.String getLabel()
    Return the label (that is, the name, the unique identifier) of the card.
    int getLastScore()
    Return the last "score" verified on the card by an checkExtraction(int) method invocation.
    int getLastScoringRow()
    Return the index within [0..2] range of the row where for the last time has been checked a number using the checkExtraction(int) method, -1 if on the card has never been checked a number before or if uncheckExtraction(int) has been recently used.
    int getLinearIndex​(int row, int column)
    Helper method that operates converting the [row,column] coordinates of a number on the card to the 'linear' index we have when considering the 15 number of the card as stored on a linear array with [0, 14] positions.
    int[] getMatchedNumbers()
    Return a linear int array containing only the numbers that have been already matched on the card.
    java.lang.String getNotes()
    Return a string of notes related to this card if previously set by setNotes()
    int getNumber​(int index)
    Return the card number at position 'index', considering the card as a unique, 'linear' array of 15 numbers.
    int getNumber​(int row, int column)
    Return the card number at the (row, column) position, if any, considering the card as formed by three rows of nine number positions each, return zero if no number is found at (row,column) position.
    TNumberCell[][] getNumberGrid()
    This method return a bi-dimensional, 3 row by 9 column array of TNumberCell objects each containing, as simple JavaBean properties, all info related to a single card number and needed during a game. Consider this data grid as an alternate representation of the card useful to be managed within web applications (i.e with Java ServerFaces technologies, etc.).
    java.lang.String getOwner()
    Helper TCard property aimed to hold a simply textual name representing the player that eventually owns the card during a Tombola game.
    int getScoreOnRow​(int rowIndex)
    Return the score on the row of the card identified by the rowIndex parameters, -1 if the passed argument is outside the [0..2] valid range.
    int getTotalScore()
    Return the current total score of the card, as the sum of the scores reached on all of the three rows.
    boolean hasLastScoreUsedJolly()
    Use this method to check if in the last positive result checking numbers on the card with checkExtraction(int), jolly number was involved (except if the extraction lead to the Tombola award, of course).
    boolean isJolly​(int row, int column)
    Check if the number in [row, column] position exists and is Jolly and, if the case, return true with no changes to the status of the card.
    boolean isMatched​(int number)
    Checks if a number has been already checked on a card, WITH NO CHANGES to the status of the card.
    boolean isMatched​(int row, int column)
    Checks if a number has been already checked on a card, WITH NO CHANGES to the status of the card.
    java.lang.String matchsAsString()
    Return a compact but still human readable String that, aligned with the String returned by asString(), indicates which numbers have been checked or not during a Tombola game.
    void resetCompareResult()
    Reset the internal card variables holding the maximum equal numbers founded by compareByCard(TCard) and compareByRow(TCard) methods.
    void resetGameStatus()
    Reset the information (status) saved by extraction checking methods during a Tombola Game.
    void setNotes​(java.lang.String notes)
    Set a text field containing free supporting info related to this card
    void setOwner​(java.lang.String owner)
    Set a simply text field aimed to hold the name of the player that owns the card during a Tombola game.
    int uncheckExtraction​(int number)
    Revert game status parameters of the card as if the number passed in input has never been extracted. Return -3 if the argument is outside of the valid [1..90] range; -2 if the number is on the card but has not already been checked (a mistake?!?); -1 if no number has been unchecked, and, finally, the (linear) position of the unchecked number otherwise. Attention! The use of this method invalidate results for
    hasLastScoreUsedJolly(), getLastScore() and getLastScoringRow() results.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • grid

      protected TNumberCell[][] grid

  • Constructor Details

    • TCard

      public TCard​(java.lang.String label)
      "Offhand" constructor that can be used to randomly generate a single, well formed, independent TCard object. Each card has a label property used to uniquely identify it, specially helpful when the card belongs to a (large) set of series (see the ISetFactory interface).
      Parameters:
      label - A symbolic name usually used to uniquely identify the card.
      See Also:
      TMakeSix, ISetFactory

    • TCard

      public TCard​(java.lang.String label, long randomSeed, boolean avoidEmptyColumn)
      "Offhand" constructor that can be used to randomly generate a single, well formed, independent TCard object, choosing its name (label), the seed used to initialize the random numbers generator and another aesthetic parameter. Important! Passing the same randomSeed value to this constructor generates identical card objects (same 15 numbers on the cards in the same disposition).
      Parameters:
      label - A symbolic name usually used to uniquely identify the card.
      randomSeed - the seed used to initialize the pseudo random number generator used to prepare the card. Use the same seed to generate cards with identical numbers and numbers disposition.
      avoidEmptyColumn - true to avoid that on classical number disposition of a card, the grid of 3 rows and 9 columns, a totally empty column appears. This could be just an aesthetic issue, cards are well formed and perfectly working in any case. A 'true' value for this parameter could reduce performance when creating large sets of cards.

  • Method Details

    • getLabel

      public java.lang.String getLabel()
      Return the label (that is, the name, the unique identifier) of the card. Label have importance when cards are collected in huge sets and possibly used by large group of friends to play. TSeriesList objects are used within this library to collect and deal with such large sets of cards, as well as to provide 'progressive' labels for identifing them.
      Returns:
      the string containing the name of the card, usually defined at card creation time.
      See Also:
      TSeriesList.prepareLabels()

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber​(int row, int column)
      Return the card number at the (row, column) position, if any, considering the card as formed by three rows of nine number positions each, return zero if no number is found at (row,column) position.
      Parameters:
      row - is the row index of the requested card number. It must be within [0,2] interval.
      column - is the column index of the requested card number. It must be within [0,8] interval.
      Returns:
      card number in position (row, column) if any, 0 otherwise.

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber​(int index)
      Return the card number at position 'index', considering the card as a unique, 'linear' array of 15 numbers.
      Parameters:
      index - the 'linear' index of the desired number. It must be within [0,14] interval. Attention! For performance reasons no checks are made on index validity. Out of bounds values will rise runtime Java exceptions.
      Returns:
      card Number at 'index' position.

    • checkConformity

      public int checkConformity()
      Check if the card object is correct and 'well formed', that is if its numbers are actually disposed so that the card is a valid card for the Tombola Game (five different numbers of different tens on each of the three rows, ...). This method is useful mainly when cards objects are not generated by TombolaLib constructors or generation methods, but read from external, potentially uncontrolled files or other sources.
      Returns:
      -1 if the card is well formed, the position within [0,14] range of the first number raising an issue.

    • compareByRow

      public int compareByRow​(TCard other)
      This method compare two cards (this one and the other one) row by row looking for equal numbers. 9 rows couples are compared and the maximum amount of equal numbers between one of this couples is both returned and saved within the state of this or the other card whenever it is higher of eventually previous saved values. Consider this method as an helping method used within card sets generator algorithms to check/reduce/eliminate cards resulting "too equal" each other, thus with higher probability to lead to concurrent wins.
      Parameters:
      other - The second TCard objects against to compare each rows.
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of equal numbers between all the 9 compared couples of rows.
      See Also:
      ISetFactory

    • compareByCard

      public int compareByCard​(TCard other)
      This method compare two cards (this one and the other one) looking for equal numbers between them. The amount of equal numbers found is both returned and internally saved within the state of this or the other card whenever it is higher of eventually previous saved values. Consider this method as an helping method mainly used by card sets generator algorithms to check/reduce/eliminate cards "too equal" each other, thus with higher probability to lead to concurrent wins.
      Parameters:
      other - The second TCard objects against to compare the card.
      Returns:
      the amount of equal numbers found between the two cards.
      See Also:
      ISetFactory

    • resetCompareResult

      public void resetCompareResult()
      Reset the internal card variables holding the maximum equal numbers founded by compareByCard(TCard) and compareByRow(TCard) methods.

    • getJolly

      public int getJolly()
      Return the number (one of the 15 numbers of the card) considered "Jolly" for this card. Syntactic sugar: c.getJolly(); is equivalent to c.getNumber(c.getJollyIndex());
      Returns:
      the number (the value) considered "Jolly" for this card. -1 if the "Jolly number" feature has not been activated and used.
      See Also:
      getJollyIndex()

    • getJollyIndex

      public int getJollyIndex()
      Return the linear index of the Jolly Number of the card, that is its position within the [0,14] array of numbers arranged on three rows and forming the card.
      Returns:
      the linear position of the Jolly Number of the card. -1 if the Jolly is not active on this card.
      See Also:
      getJolly()

    • isJolly

      public boolean isJolly​(int row, int column)
      Check if the number in [row, column] position exists and is Jolly and, if the case, return true with no changes to the status of the card.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the number you want to check if is jolly
      column - the column index of the number you want to check if is jolly
      Returns:
      true if the in the [row,colum] position there is a number and it is the jolly one, false otherwise.

    • getCurrentMaxEPC

      public int getCurrentMaxEPC()
      Return the maximum amount of equal numbers between two cards found for this card using the compareByCard(harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard) method since the card creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of equal numbers between two cards found until now for this card.

    • getCurrentMaxEPR

      public int getCurrentMaxEPR()
      Return the maximum amount of equal numbers between each row of two cards found for this card rows using the compareByRow(harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard) method since the card creation or a call to resetCompareResult().
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of equal numbers between the rows of two cards found until now for this card.

    • getLinearIndex

      public int getLinearIndex​(int row, int column)
      Helper method that operates converting the [row,column] coordinates of a number on the card to the 'linear' index we have when considering the 15 number of the card as stored on a linear array with [0, 14] positions. Returns -1 if in [row, column] there is no number.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the number you want the 'linear index'. It must be in the [0..2] range.
      column - The column index of the number you want the 'linear index'. It must be in the [0..8] range.
      Returns:
      The linear index corresponding to the number in [row, column] position if it exists, -1 otherwise.

    • getNotes

      public java.lang.String getNotes()
      Return a string of notes related to this card if previously set by setNotes()
      Returns:
      textual notes eventually associated to this card

    • setNotes

      public void setNotes​(java.lang.String notes)
      Set a text field containing free supporting info related to this card
      Parameters:
      notes - the string of text you want to associate to this card

    • getOwner

      public java.lang.String getOwner()
      Helper TCard property aimed to hold a simply textual name representing the player that eventually owns the card during a Tombola game.
      Returns:
      the player name currently owning this card

    • setOwner

      public void setOwner​(java.lang.String owner)
      Set a simply text field aimed to hold the name of the player that owns the card during a Tombola game.
      Parameters:
      owner - and identifying name of the person owning the card during a tombola game

    • asString

      public java.lang.String asString()
      Return a compact but still human readable String representing the card instance. The string comes in a CSV fashion line, containing:
      • The card label, comprised between string delimiters;
      • The 15 numbers of the cards (first row; second row; third row);
      • The linear index of the Jolly number, closed in circular brackets
      • A checksum code, useful to control correctness when data are transferred and/or manipulated outside the TombolaLib library. This checksum is evaluated using evaluateCheckSum(long) whit zero as offset value.
      Here follows an example:

        "TestCard";05;10;22;73;83;25;44;55;66;76;14;34;40;62;89;(7);"KT"

      This is just an helper method used mainly for test/control purposes. Other card "conversion" and "formatting" methods are provided by TCardFormatter class.

      Returns:
      a compact, human readable String representing the card instance.
      See Also:
      TCardFormatter.cardToString(TCard)

    • matchsAsString

      public java.lang.String matchsAsString()
      Return a compact but still human readable String that, aligned with the String returned by asString(), indicates which numbers have been checked or not during a Tombola game. The string comes in a CSV fashion line, containing:
      • The card label, comprised between string delimiters;
      • 15 "Visual indicators": white space corresponding to numbers on the card not extracted jet, asterisks corresponding to numbers of the card already extracted and exclamation mark if the Jolly number has been extracted.
      • A checksum code, useful to control correctness when data are transferred and/or manipulated outside the TombolaLib library. This checksum is evaluated using evaluateCheckSum(long) whit zero as offset value. It must be equal to the checksum returned by asString() method.
      Here follows an example (let's suppose that 22, 55, 14 and 62 have been already extracted):

        c.asString():         "TestCard";05;10;22;73;83;25;44;55;66;76;14;34;40;62;89;(7);"KT"
        c.matchsAsString():   "TestCard";  ;  ; *;  ;  ;  ;  ;!!;  ;  ; *;  ;  ; *;  ;"KT"

      This is just an helper method used mainly for test/control purposes. Other card "conversion" and "formatting" methods are provided by TCardFormatter class.

      Returns:
      a compact, human readable String representing the card instance.
      See Also:
      TCardFormatter.cardToString(TCard)

    • evaluateCheckSum

      public java.lang.String evaluateCheckSum​(long offset)
      Evaluate a checksum of the Card using a simple formulas applied on the its numbers. It can be used to verify that nobody has changed in an uncontrolled way any number of the card.
      Parameters:
      offset - A value that inserted into the checksum evaluation, so to give variance and control possibilities to the users of this library.
      Returns:
      A String composed by two chars belonging to this charset: "0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"

    • resetGameStatus

      public final void resetGameStatus()
      Reset the information (status) saved by extraction checking methods during a Tombola Game. This method MUST be called on each TCARD object before starting a game.

    • checkExtraction

      public int checkExtraction​(int extractedNumber)
      This is the fundamental method to let check if a card gain an award during a Tombola game. It must be invoked at each number extraction, for all the card participating to the game. The extracted number is passed as its unique argument. It returns:
      • -1 if the extracted number passed as argument is outside the [1..90] valid range
      • 0 if the card does not contain the extracted number OR if the card contains the extracted number but it has already been checked with a previous invocation to this method.
      • The total score reached on the row where the extracted number has been found, PLUS the scores of eventually other rows where a 5 score (quintina award) has been already reached before. In this way, for instance, the method return 10 when quintina is reached on two rows and 15 when Tombola is reached (all numbers are checked). Otherwise the method return, for instance, 3 for a new "terno" even if on another row of the card is already present a quaterna.
      Parameters:
      extractedNumber - the last number extracted and to be checked on the card.
      Returns:
      The resulting "score" of the card after the check, see description above.
      See Also:
      TGame, uncheckExtraction(int), getExtractionCheckCount()

    • getBestRowScore

      public int getBestRowScore()
      This method returns the value of matched numbers on the current best row of the card, that is the row where the highest value of matched numbers is reached.
      Returns:
      the highest score reached on a single card row, within [0,5] range.

    • hasLastScoreUsedJolly

      public boolean hasLastScoreUsedJolly()
      Use this method to check if in the last positive result checking numbers on the card with checkExtraction(int), jolly number was involved (except if the extraction lead to the Tombola award, of course).
      Returns:
      true if the last positive checkExtraction(int) result on a card has involved its jolly number. False otherwise. False is returned even if the card is doing Tombola (all 15 numbers are checked so it is obvious that also the jolly number is involved).

    • getLastScoringRow

      public int getLastScoringRow()
      Return the index within [0..2] range of the row where for the last time has been checked a number using the checkExtraction(int) method, -1 if on the card has never been checked a number before or if uncheckExtraction(int) has been recently used.
      Returns:
      the index within [0..2] range of the row where for the last time has been checked a number
      See Also:
      checkExtraction(int), uncheckExtraction(int), getLastScore()

    • getLastScore

      public int getLastScore()
      Return the last "score" verified on the card by an checkExtraction(int) method invocation. -1 if on the card has never been checked a number before or if uncheckExtraction(int) has been recently used.
      Returns:
      Return the last "score" verified on the card
      See Also:
      checkExtraction(int), uncheckExtraction(int), getLastScoringRow()

    • getExtractionCheckCount

      public int getExtractionCheckCount()
      Return the number of correct (i.e. with a valid extracted number passed as parameter) checkExtraction(int) invocations since the Card creation or the last resetGameStatus() invocation. Attention! the checked extraction counter is incremented by each invocation of checkExtraction(int), even if it is wrongly called more times with the same number as argument. It is decremented by uncheckExtraction(int) invocations.
      Returns:
      the count of invocations to the check extraction method.
      See Also:
      checkExtraction(int), uncheckExtraction(int)

    • uncheckExtraction

      public int uncheckExtraction​(int number)
      Revert game status parameters of the card as if the number passed in input has never been extracted. Return -3 if the argument is outside of the valid [1..90] range; -2 if the number is on the card but has not already been checked (a mistake?!?); -1 if no number has been unchecked, and, finally, the (linear) position of the unchecked number otherwise. Attention! The use of this method invalidate results for
      hasLastScoreUsedJolly(), getLastScore() and getLastScoringRow() results.
      Parameters:
      number - the number pushed back into the "sacchetto"
      Returns:
      the (linear) position of the unchecked number in the [0..14] range, a negative value otherwise.

    • isMatched

      public boolean isMatched​(int number)
      Checks if a number has been already checked on a card, WITH NO CHANGES to the status of the card.
      Parameters:
      number - Extracted number to be verified on the card
      Returns:
      true is the number is present on the card and has been previously checked, false otherwise.

    • isMatched

      public boolean isMatched​(int row, int column)
      Checks if a number has been already checked on a card, WITH NO CHANGES to the status of the card.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the number you want to check if is jolly
      column - the column index of the number you want to check if is jolly
      Returns:
      true is the number is present on the card and has been previously checked, false otherwise.

    • getTotalScore

      public int getTotalScore()
      Return the current total score of the card, as the sum of the scores reached on all of the three rows.
      Returns:
      the current total score of the card, as the sum of the scores of the three rows.

    • getScoreOnRow

      public int getScoreOnRow​(int rowIndex)
      Return the score on the row of the card identified by the rowIndex parameters, -1 if the passed argument is outside the [0..2] valid range.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the index of the row you want to know the actual score.
      Returns:
      the score on the row

    • getMatchedNumbers

      public int[] getMatchedNumbers()
      Return a linear int array containing only the numbers that have been already matched on the card.
      Returns:
      an int array containing only the numbers already matched on the card.

    • getNumberGrid

      public TNumberCell[][] getNumberGrid()
      This method return a bi-dimensional, 3 row by 9 column array of TNumberCell objects each containing, as simple JavaBean properties, all info related to a single card number and needed during a game. Consider this data grid as an alternate representation of the card useful to be managed within web applications (i.e with Java ServerFaces technologies, etc.).
      Returns:
      a [3,9] array of TNumberCell representing the card
